```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# Load necessary libraries in the setup chunk
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
```

## Interactive Plot

This simple Quarto app reads data from a CSV file, displays it in a table, and allows users to select a column for plotting.

```{r}
# Load data from CSV
data <- read.csv("data.csv")

# Define UI
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Sample Quarto Shiny App"),
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      selectInput("column", "Select a Column:", choices = colnames(data)),
      actionButton("updatePlot", "Update Plot")
    ),
    mainPanel(
      tableOutput("dataTable"),
      plotOutput("plot")
    )
  )
)

# Define server logic
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  output$dataTable <- renderTable({
    head(data) # Show first few rows of the data
  })
  
  observeEvent(input$updatePlot, {
    output$plot <- renderPlot({
      ggplot(data, aes_string(x = input$column)) +
        geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) +
        labs(title = paste("Histogram of", input$column), x = input$column)
    })
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
```
